feature: Add Skip-to-Main-Content Link for Keyboard Navigation
description: Implement a skip-link that appears on keyboard focus, allowing users to bypass the header and navigate directly to the main dashboard content.

phases.title: Create SkipLink Component
phases.description: Create a reusable SkipLink component following WCAG accessibility guidelines

subtasks.title: Create SkipLink component file
subtasks.description: Create acgs2-frontend/policy-marketplace/src/components/SkipLink.tsx with a reusable skip link component that is visually hidden until focused

subtasks.title: Add skip link styles to index.css
subtasks.description: Add CSS classes for the skip link that position it off-screen by default and bring it into view on focus, ensuring high z-index and proper accessibility

phases.title: Integrate SkipLink into Application
phases.description: Add the skip link to all pages and add proper ID anchors to main content areas

subtasks.title: Update App.tsx page components with skip link and main content ID
subtasks.description: Add SkipLink component and id='main-content' to the main element in all page components: HomePage, TemplatesPage, TemplateDetailPage, and UploadPage

subtasks.title: Export SkipLink from component index
subtasks.description: Add SkipLink to acgs2-frontend/policy-marketplace/src/components/index.ts for better module organization

phases.title: Testing and Verification
phases.description: Test the skip link functionality and verify keyboard accessibility

subtasks.title: Manual keyboard navigation verification on all pages
subtasks.description: Manually test keyboard navigation by pressing Tab on each page (Home, Templates, Template Detail, Upload) to verify skip link appears and clicking it skips to main content

subtasks.title: Build and verify no errors
subtasks.description: Run build command (npm run build or vite build) to ensure TypeScript compiles without errors

technical_notes: Using Tailwind CSS for styling with sr-only pattern for screen reader accessibility
Skip link should be the first focusable element on the page for optimal keyboard navigation
Main content areas need unique IDs (main-content) to serve as skip link targets
Following WCAG 2.1 Level A requirement for bypass blocks (Success Criterion 2.4.1)
The skip link will be positioned absolute, initially off-screen (-translate-y-full), and brought into view on focus
Using high z-index (z-50) to ensure skip link appears above all other content when focused
Project already has custom focus-visible styles in index.css that will apply to the skip link
Smooth scrolling is already enabled in the CSS for better UX when skip link is activated
testing_strategy: Manual keyboard navigation testing with Tab key on all pages
Verify skip link is first focusable element on page
Test skip link activation moves focus to main content
Build verification to ensure TypeScript compiles without errors
final_acceptance: Skip link is the first focusable element when user presses Tab
Skip link becomes visible when focused via keyboard
Clicking/activating skip link moves focus to main content area
Skip link is hidden from view but accessible to screen readers when not focused
Implementation works on all pages: HomePage, TemplatesPage, TemplateDetailPage, and UploadPage
Skip link has clear, descriptive text (e.g., 'Skip to main content')
